sentence.Network_en: If you ever cross him, forget it, you're finished.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果你曾经和他作对过，就别想了，你没戏了。

sentence.Network_en: The priest made the sign of the cross over him.
sentence.Network_cn: 神父在他上方画了个十字。

sentence.Network_en: I've never seen him get cross or lose his temper.
sentence.Network_cn: 我从未见过他生气或者发火。

划线支票（Crossed  Cheque）是在支票正面划两道平行线的支票。划线支票与一般支票不同，划线支票非由银行不得领取票款，故只 …
相声相声（Cross talk）一种民间说唱曲艺。相声艺术源于华北，流行于京津冀，普及于全国及海内外，始于明清，盛于当代。
十字绣（cross stitch），是用专用的绣线和十字格布，利用经纬交织的搭十字的方法，对照专用的坐标图案进行刺绣的绣品。十字绣 …

jx.jx_en_mean: misunderstanding or having different aims from one another

lj.lj_ly: we had been talking at cross purposes.
lj.lj_ls: 我们一直带着相反的目的交谈。

jx.jx_en_mean: (或 keep one's fingers crossed)put one finger across another as a sign of hoping for good luck
jx.jx_cn_mean: 手指交叉（把食指与中指交叉，希望得到好运气）

phrase.cizu_name: cross my heart (and hope to die)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to emphasize the truthfulness and sincerity of what one is saying, and sometimes reinforced by making a sign of the cross over one's chest
jx.jx_cn_mean: 千真万确（用于强调所说的话的真实性，有时伴有在胸口画十字的动作）

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a thought) occur to one, especially transiently

lj.lj_ly: it had not crossed Flora's mind that they might need payment.
lj.lj_ls: 弗洛拉还没有想到他们可能需要付款。

jx.jx_en_mean: (oftenhumorous)pay someone for a favour or service, especially before having one's fortune told
jx.jx_cn_mean: (常幽默)（得到帮助或服务，尤指算命前）付钱

jx.jx_en_mean: a telephone connection that has been wrongly made with the result that another call or calls can be heard

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English (in the sense 'monument in the form of a cross'): from Old Norse kross, from Old Irish cros, from Latin crux

encyclopedia.content: CROSS笔品牌历史 1846年起，CROSS即开始为珍爱传统美感的品味人士，制作永不退流行的的优质书写工具。 1958年来，各式精美的CROSS书写工具均展现出典雅、优质与顶级的品味。从细致的CENTURY、典雅的TOWNSEND，到时髦的ATX、创新的morph、充满创意的ION口袋笔、简洁利落的MATRIX，CROSS一再为精笔制造业订定了高质量与完美的工匠艺术，亦深受众多世界知名人士的爱戴。前美国总统布什在就职大典上，即选用TOWNSEND涛声系列蓝珐琅笔

entry.def: If you cross something such as a room, a road, or an area of land or water, you move or travel to the other side of it. If you cross to a place, you move or travel over a room, road, or area of land or water in order to reach that place.

example.ex: She was partly to blame for failing to look as she crossed the road...
example.tran: 她过马路时没注意看，负有部分责任。

example.ex: Nine Albanians have crossed the border into Greece and asked for political asylum...
example.tran: 9名阿尔巴尼亚人穿过边境进入希腊境内并寻求政治避难。

entry.def: A road, railway, or bridge that crosses an area of land or water passes over it.

example.ex: The Defford to Eckington road crosses the river half a mile outside Eckington.
example.tran: 从迪福德到埃金顿的路穿过那条距埃金顿半英里的河。

entry.def: Lines or roads that cross meet and go across each other.

example.ex: ...the intersection where Main and Center streets cross...
example.tran: 主街和中心街的交叉路口

example.ex: It is near where the pilgrimage route crosses the road to Quimper.
example.tran: 那儿离朝圣之路与通往坎佩尔的道路的交叉路口很近。

entry.def: If someone or something crosses a limit or boundary, for example the limit of acceptable behaviour, they go beyond it.

example.ex: I normally never write into magazines but Mr Stubbs has finally crossed the line...
example.tran: 我向来不给杂志写信，但是斯塔布斯先生最后做得太过火了。

example.ex: No party is entitled to a seat in the new parliament unless it gets at least 5 per cent of the vote. Many will fail to cross that threshold.
example.tran: 任何政党只有获得至少5%的选票才能够在新一届议会中获得一个席位。很多政党都过不了这个门槛。

entry.def: If an expression crosses someone's face, it appears briefly on their face.

example.ex: Berg tilts his head and a mischievous look crosses his face...
example.tran: 伯格侧着头，脸上掠过一丝调皮的神情。

example.ex: A faint smile crossed his lips.
example.tran: 他嘴唇上掠过一丝微笑。

entry.tran: 十字形，十字架(基督教最重要的标记)
entry.def: A cross is a shape that consists of a vertical line or piece with a shorter horizontal line or piece across it. It is the most important Christian symbol.

example.ex: Round her neck was a cross on a silver chain...
example.tran: 她脖子上戴着一条银项链，上面挂着个十字架。

example.ex: He solemnly made the sign of the cross...
example.tran: 他庄重地画了个十字。

entry.def: If Christians cross themselves, they make the sign of a cross by moving their hand across the top half of their body.

example.ex: 'Holy Mother of God!' Marco crossed himself.
example.tran: “圣母啊！”马尔科画着十字说道。

entry.def: If you describe something as a cross that someone has to bear, you mean it is a problem or disadvantage which they have to deal with or bear.

example.ex: My wife is much cleverer than me; it is a cross I have to bear.
example.tran: 妻子比我聪明很多，这让我很难接受。

entry.tran: 叉字形记号;十字形记号
entry.def: A cross is a written mark in the shape of an X. You can use it, for example, to indicate that an answer to a question is wrong, to mark the position of something on a map, or to indicate your vote on a ballot paper.

example.ex: Put a tick next to those activities you like and a cross next to those you dislike.
example.tran: 在你喜欢的活动旁打钩，在不喜欢的活动旁画叉。

entry.tran: 在(支票)上画两条平行线(使支票只能划入银行账户，不能兑现)
entry.def: If a cheque is crossed, two parallel lines are drawn across it or printed on it to indicate that it must be paid into a bank account and cannot be cashed.

example.ex: Cheques/postal orders should be crossed and made payable to Newmarket Promotions.
example.tran: 应在支票/邮政汇票上画线，并使之可用于新市场促销活动的支付。

example.ex: ...a crossed cheque.
example.tran: 画线支票

entry.def: If you cross your arms, legs, or fingers, you put one of them on top of the other.

example.ex: Jill crossed her legs and rested her chin on one fist, as if lost in deep thought...
example.tran: 吉尔盘着腿，一个拳头支着下巴，仿佛陷入了沉思。

example.ex: Pop crossed his arms over his chest and watched us...
example.tran: 波普叉着胳膊看着我们。

entry.def: If you cross someone who is likely to get angry, you oppose them or refuse to do what they want.

example.ex: If you ever cross him, forget it, you're finished.
example.tran: 如果你曾经跟他作过对，就别想了，你没戏了。

entry.def: Something that is a cross between two things is neither one thing nor the other, but a mixture of both.

example.ex: 'Ha!' It was a cross between a laugh and a bark...
example.tran: “哈！”那声音听起来既像在笑又像在叫。

example.ex: It was a lovely dog. It was a cross between a collie and a golden retriever.
example.tran: 那条狗可爱极了，是柯利牧羊犬和金毛猎犬的杂交品种。

entry.tran: (足球、曲棍球等球队运动中的)横传
entry.def: In some team sports such as football and hockey, a cross is the passing of the ball from the side of the field to a player in the centre, usually in front of the goal.

example.ex: Le Tissier hit an accurate cross to Groves.
example.tran: 勒蒂西耶将球准确地横传给了格罗夫斯。

entry.def: A cross street is a road that crosses another more important road.

example.ex: The Army boys had personnel carriers blockading the cross streets.
example.tran: 陆军士兵用运兵车封锁了十字路口。

entry.def: Someone who is cross is rather angry or irritated.

example.ex: The women are cross and bored...
example.tran: 这个女人很生气，烦透了。

example.ex: I'm terribly cross with him...
example.tran: 我很生他的气。

means.word_mean: 1. a wooden structure consisting of an upright post with a transverse piece
2. marking consisting of crossing lines
3. a cross as an emblem of Christianity; used in heraldry
4. any affliction that causes great suffering;

sentences.sentence: "he bears his afflictions like a crown of thorns"

means.word_mean: 5. an organism that is the offspring of genetically dissimilar parents or stock; especially offspring produced by breeding plants or animals of different varieties or breeds or species;

sentences.sentence: "a mule is a cross between a horse and a donkey"

means.word_mean: 6. (genetics) the act of mixing different species or varieties of animals or plants and thus to produce hybrids
1. travel across or pass over;

sentences.sentence: "The caravan covered almost 100 miles each day"

means.word_mean: 2. meet at a point
3. hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of;

sentences.sentence: "What ultimately frustrated every challenger was Ruth's amazing September surge"

means.word_mean: 4. fold so as to resemble a cross;
5. to cover or extend over an area or time period;

sentences.sentence: "Rivers traverse the valley floor", "The parking lot spans 3 acres"

means.word_mean: 6. meet and pass;
7. trace a line through or across;
8. breed animals or plants using parents of different races and varieties;
1. extending or lying across; in a crosswise direction; at right angles to the long axis;

sentences.sentence: "from the transverse hall the stairway ascends gracefully"

means.word_mean: 2. perversely irritable

means.word_mean: 十字架

sentences.en: They marked the exact place of that hospital with a red cross.
sentences.cn: 他们用一个红十字标出那所医院所在的确切位置。

means.word_mean: 画十字的动作

sentences.en: He made a cross over his head.
sentences.cn: 他在他头上画了一个十字。

means.word_mean: 杂交品种; 混合物

sentences.en: A mule is a cross between a mare and a donkey.
sentences.cn: 骡子是雌马和驴的杂交种。

means.word_mean: 痛苦, 苦难

sentences.en: We all have our cross, I suppose.
sentences.cn: 我想我们大家都有苦难。

means.word_mean: 穿过, 越过, 渡过

sentences.en: They crossed from England to France.
sentences.cn: 他们从英国渡过海峡到法国去。

sentences.en: We have to cross the railway line by the foot bridge.
sentences.cn: 我们不得不从人行桥上越过铁路线。

means.word_mean: 交叉, 相交; 错过

sentences.en: Line A crosses line B at right angles.

means.word_mean: 反对, 阻挠; 使受挫折

sentences.en: Cross me and you'll regret it.
sentences.cn: 和我作对, 你会后悔的。

means.word_mean: 在…上打叉，划掉，注销，勾销(常与 off， out 连用)

sentences.en: He crossed his name off the list.
sentences.cn: 他把他的名字从名单上划掉。

means.word_mean: 公开反对；反驳；否定；阻挠

sentences.en: He is a friendly enough person, so long as you don't cross him in his business plans.
sentences.cn: 只要在他的营业计划方面你不公开反对他，他还是一个和蔼可亲的人。

means.word_mean: 坏脾气的, 易怒的

sentences.en: The cross and hungry children came in.
sentences.cn: 又气又饿的孩子们走了进来。

means.word_mean: 相反的, 反向的

sentences.en: It was just a result cross to our purpose.
sentences.cn: 这恰恰是与我们的目的相反的结果。

jushi.english: The drink tasted like a cross between coffee and hot chocolate.
jushi.chinese: 这饮料喝起来像是咖啡和巧克力的混合物。

jushi.english: They mark them with a red cross.
jushi.chinese: 他们用一个红十字标出它们。
